refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Mvclpf4 is an digital implementation of the 4th-order (24 dB/oct) Moog ladder filter originally written by Fons Andriaensen. It is a version of the mvclpf3 opcode with four outputs, for 6dB, 12dB, 18dB, and 24 dB/octave responses.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: asig1,asig2,asig3,asig4 mvclpf4 ain, xcf, xres[, istor]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: istor --initial disposition of internal data space. Since filtering incorporates a feedback loop of previous output, the initial status of the storage space used is significant. A zero value will clear the space; a non-zero value will allow previous information to remain. The default value is 0.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: xcf -- filter cutoff frequency. The useful range is around six octaves below and above middle C (pch 8.00).
xres -- resonance, limited to the interval [0,1].
